cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts dealing with the fate and characterization of information associated with black holes, especially in the context of the information paradox and what data about infalling matter is preserved or lost.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the information paradox ... raises questions about the fate of information that falls into a black hole

members.entity_description: A theoretical puzzle in black hole physics concerning whether and how information about matter falling into a black hole is preserved or destroyed, particularly in the context of black hole evaporation via Hawking radiation.

members.entity_name: information about the contents of a black hole
members.entity_description: The complete descriptive data of matter and fields inside a black hole.
Abstract physical information whose fate is questioned when it falls into black holes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Theoretical constructs related to the holographic description of black holes, where information about their contents is encoded on the event horizon and challenges conventional views of information storage.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the holographic principle suggests that all the information about the contents of a black hole is encoded on its event horizon

members.entity_description: Concept that all information about a black holeâ€™s contents is encoded on its event horizon.
The boundary surrounding a black hole where information is thought to be encoded.

members.entity_name: traditional understanding of how information is stored
members.entity_description: Conventional notions about the localization and storage of physical information in the universe.

members.entity_name: information about the contents of a black hole
members.entity_description: The complete descriptive data of matter and fields inside a black hole.

args.new_description: Concepts dealing with the fate, preservation, and characterization of information associated with black holes, especially in the context of the black hole information paradox and what data about infalling matter is preserved or lost.
args.justification: This class focuses on the black hole information paradox and related information-fate concepts, which are distinct from but closely related to holographic formulations; assigning a shared Class_Group and slightly refining the name/description clarifies its scope within black hole information physics.

args.new_description: Theoretical constructs centered on the holographic description of black holes, in which information about their contents is encoded on the event horizon, challenging conventional notions of information storage and locality.
args.justification: This class is specifically about the holographic principle and related constructs for encoding black hole information; keeping it separate from the broader information-paradox class but placing both under a unified Class_Group and clarifying the label/description better captures their related yet distinct theoretical roles.

executed_decisions.justification: This class is specifically about the holographic principle and related constructs for encoding black hole information; keeping it separate from the broader information-paradox class but placing both under a unified Class_Group and clarifying the label/description better captures their related yet distinct theoretical roles.
